what: a btn:[Back] to navigate to previous page block modal when viewing or editing a tabbed page block.
why: to provide the user with an easier way to go back in a modal.

what: dropdown with values `25`, `50`, `100` in the record list configurator to set the amount of records that can be loaded per page in a record list.
This option is visible only to admins.
why: to allow admin users to configure how many records per page are to be loaded.

what: a delete button in the page icon configurator modal with which a user can remove an uploaded icon.
why: to provide the option to remove an uploaded icon.

what: a standardized submit button across all web applications.
why: to make UI consistent and code maintaining easier.

what: a btn:[Save as copy] to create a copy of a module or chart.
why: to allow users to easily copy the functionality of a module or chart.

what: an option to create a custom color scheme in the chart color scheme dropdown.
why: to give the user the freedom to make a custom color scheme.

what: buttons for removing and modifying a tabbed page block next to the block name.
why: to provide an easier way of editing or deleting a tabbed page block.

what: unsaved changes warning message when modifying a record and trying to navigate to a different page.
why: to prevent losing changes that haven't been saved yet.

what: support for {PRODUCT_NAME} to automatically manage and change the underlying database when storing records.
why: to simplify the process of using dedicated and customized storage locations for your records since manual intervention, for most cases, is no longer needed.

what: an option to create a custom button for a record page in its page layout configurator that will be present when viewing the page layout.
why: to provide the user with the option to create a custom button.

what: an icon containing an exclamation mark to a page block toolbar indicating that the concrete page block is used in another page layout.
why: to mark a page block that is already used in another page layout.

what: the option to change the default colors of {PRODUCT_NAME} applications in {APP_NAME_ADMIN}.
why: to provide the user with more freedom to style {PRODUCT_NAME}.

what: a rounded circle icon that marks a configuration option as performance impacting.
why: to mark which features would impact the performance of an application.

what: triggering of unsaved changes message after user wants to delete a modified resource like a page, namespace, module or chart.
why: to provide a more intuitive way to navigate in {APP_NAME_COMPOSE} after trying to delete a resource.

what: the navigation flow when switching between different {APP_NAME_COMPOSE} resources using the sidebar navigation menu.
For example, when trying to switch from one page's builder mode to another, you were redirected to the edit mode of the page.
why: to provide a more intuitive way to navigate between {APP_NAME_COMPOSE} resources.

what: the functionality of the delete and un-delete button by extending it to show a spinner while a resource is being deleted or un-deleted.
why: to show the user the current state of the delete or un-delete process.

what: the syntax of forms for creating and modifying a resource to better support mobile users in {APP_NAME_ADMIN}.
why: to provide a better UI and UE for mobile users.

what: the updating cycle of page blocks showing the same data to refresh after a change has been made to that data in a different page block.
why: to keep all page blocks showing related data in sync.

what: general ui/ux improvements:
** Improved header button layout for topbar navigation and resource list items.
** Adjusted position of btn:[x] in search bar to always appear on the right side.
the following mobile issues in {APP_NAME_ADMIN}:
- Unnecessary vertical and horizontal scrolling of resource list parent component.
- Header buttons in resource editing view were partially/completely hidden if more than two were displayed.
- Longer labels in resource editing view appeared under their input fields.
namespace export erroring out with an invalid reference error whenever we're referring to deleted resources.
how: by ignoring missing references and exporting/importing regardless of missing references.
This should be expanded and improved upon in a future release.
